original: Ljunggren, Josef Efraim, apotekare, Lysekil, f. 30/8/83 i Eksjö av Axel L. o. Maria Jonsson. G. 19 m. Maria Heldt. Barn: Kerstin f. 20, g. 45 m. tj:m. James Wilkens, Sthlm, Ulf 23. — Mog:ex. i Linköp. 05, farm. kand. 09, apot:ex. 15. Elev v. apot. Kronan i Linköp. 05-08, anst. v. apot. i Sollefteå, Kopparberg o. Gamleby 09-17, Sollebrunn (förest.) 17-19, Svanen i Sthlm, apot. i Amål, Svanen i Norrköp. 21-33, priv. å. apot. i Råneå 33, transp. t. apot. i Lysekil 39. V. sekr. i Östg .’krets, av Sv. farmrförb. 22-32, rev. i Norrb. krets av Sv. apot:förb. 34-38. Hobbies: musik, idrott.
translated: Ljunggren, Josef Efraim, pharmacist, Lysekil, b. August 30th, 1883 in Eksjö to Axel L. and Maria Jonsson. Married in 1919 to Maria Heldt. Children: Kerstin, b. 1920, married in 1945 to James Wilkens, Stockholm, and Ulf, b. 1923. Obtained a degree in pharmacy from Linköping University in 1905, pharmaceuticals degree in 1909, and pharmacy license in 1915. Was a student at the Kronan Pharmacy in Linköping from 1905 to 1908, employed at pharmacies in Sollefteå, Kopparberg, and Gamleby from 1909 to 1917, interim manager in Sollebrunn from 1917 to 1919, at Svanen Pharmacy in Stockholm, Amål Pharmacy, and Svanen Pharmacy in Norrköping from 1921 to 1933, and operated a private pharmacy in Råneå from 1933, transferred to Lysekil in 1939. Was vice secretary in the Östergötland district of the Swedish Pharmaceutical Association from 1922 to 1932, and an auditor in the Norrbotten district of the Swedish Pharmacist Association from 1934 to 1938. Hobbies include music and sports.

structured.name: Josef Efraim Ljunggren
structured.description: Pharmacist, interested in music and sports.
